docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on Thursday upheld most of President Obama’s health care overhaul law, saying it was authorized by Congress’s power to levy taxes.

headline.main: Supreme Court Upholds Health Care Law

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court on Thursday upheld most of President Obama’s health care overhaul law, saying it was authorized by Congress’s power to levy taxes.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court largely let the health care overhaul stand, upholding the individual mandate and limiting the Medicaid provision.

headline.seo: How the Justices Ruled on the Health Care Law
headline.main: How the Justices Ruled on the Health Care Law

docs.lead_paragraph: Surveys indicate that support by Turks of joining the European Union has declined. But one thing Turks want from the Union is visa liberalization and the freedom to travel to Europe.

headline.main: Turks Seek Freedom to Travel to Europe Without Visas
headline.print_headline: Turks Seek Freedom to Travel to Europe Without Visas

docs.snippet: Surveys indicate that support by Turks of joining the European Union has declined. But one thing Turks want from the Union is visa liberalization and the freedom to travel to Europe.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said more homeowners were taking out reverse mortgages at their first opportunity, often without fully understanding the loans.

headline.seo: Report Highlights a Rise in Reverse Mortgages
headline.main: Report Highlights a Rise in Reverse Mortgages
headline.print_headline: Report Highlights a Rise In Reverse Mortgages

docs.abstract: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau says more homeowners are taking out reverse mortgages at their first opportunity--age 62, under federal law--often without fully understanding the loans; says they are often using the proceeds to pay off other debt, a troubling trend.
docs.snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said more homeowners were taking out reverse mortgages at their first opportunity, often without fully understanding the loans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mexicali, Mexico, has made medical care its primary lure for visitors from California and other nearby states.

headline.seo: Mexicali Lures American Tourists With Medical Care
headline.main: Mexicali Tour, From Tummy Tuck to Root Canal
headline.sub: Mexicali Tour, From Tummy Tuck to Root Canal
headline.print_headline: Mexicali Tour, From Tummy Tuck to Root Canal

docs.abstract: Mexicali, Mexico, has made medical care its primary lure for visitors from California and other nearby states; more than 150,000 people crossed the border in 2011 in search of care they either could not afford or wished to get more cheaply; influx increasingly includes a small but growing number of middle-class patients looking for deals on elective surgeries that most medical insurance will not cover.
docs.snippet: Mexicali, Mexico, has made medical care its primary lure for visitors from California and other nearby states.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress is running out of time to iron out an agreement to subsidize interest rates on Stafford loans.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends that Senate compromise to prevent interest rates on student loans from doubling is necessary, but not ideal; urges the House to quickly pass the measure; contends that deal, which will last only one year, is no substitute for a long-term and robust subsidy for student loans.
docs.snippet: Congress is running out of time to iron out an agreement to subsidize interest rates on Stafford loans.

docs.lead_paragraph: How well have you been paying attention to the men running for president? Take this quiz to find out.
docs.abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column offers a quiz concerning the policies and opinions of Pres Obama and Mitt Romney.
docs.snippet: How well have you been paying attention to the men running for president? Take this quiz to find out.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court’s expected decision Thursday on the health care overhaul that President Obama signed into law in 2010 could affect nearly every American from cradle to grave.

headline.seo: Ruling Expected on Health Care Law
headline.main: Awaiting Ruling on Fairly Simple Questions About a Complex Health Law
headline.sub: Awaiting Ruling on Fairly Simple Questions
headline.print_headline: Awaiting Ruling on Fairly Simple Questions About a Complex Health Law

docs.abstract: Supreme Court's highly-anticipated decision on the Affordable Care Act is likely to turn on a narrow set of specific constitutional questions; chief issue remains whether or not Congress overstepped its powers by requiring virtually all Americans to obtain health insurance or pay a penalty.
docs.snippet: The Supreme Court’s expected decision Thursday on the health care overhaul that President Obama signed into law in 2010 could affect nearly every American from cradle to grave.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Spain and Cyprus may be the current locus of European anxiety, but many other banks are in a weakened state, cut off from money markets because investors do not trust them.

headline.main: Europe’s Mightiest Banks Still Grapple With Crisis
headline.print_headline: Beyond Spain and Cyprus, Europe’s Mightiest Banks Still Grapple With Crisis

docs.abstract: Spain and Cyprus may be the current locus of European anxiety, but many other banks are in a weakened state, cut off from money markets because investors do not trust them; economists say European leaders meeting in Brussels must confront broader problems in the banking system if they want to stabilize the euro zone.
docs.snippet: Spain and Cyprus may be the current locus of European anxiety, but many other banks are in a weakened state, cut off from money markets because investors do not trust them.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and DAVID JOLLY

docs.lead_paragraph: Better-than-expected economic data helped lift energy stocks, which showed the best gains among the major groups in the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index.

headline.main: Strength in Energy Sector Helps Buoy Markets
headline.print_headline: Strength in Energy Sector Helps Buoy Markets

docs.abstract: Stocks rise as better-than-expected economic data helps lift energy stocks.
docs.snippet: Better-than-expected economic data helped lift energy stocks, which showed the best gains among the major groups in the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index.
